\theight: 1em;\n    \tvertical-align: baseline;\n}\n\n.tc-tree li span {\n    \tcolor: lightgray;\n}\n\nselect {\n        color: <<colour select-tag-foreground>>;\n        background: <<colour select-tag-background>>;\n}\n\n/*\n** Utility classes for SVG icons\n*/\n\n.tc-fill-background {\n\tfill: <<colour background>>;\n}\n\n/*\n** Flexbox utility classes\n*/\n\n.tc-flex {\n\tdisplay: -webkit-flex;\n\tdisplay: flex;\n}\n\n.tc-flex-column {\n\tflex-direction: column;\n}\n\n.tc-flex-row {\n\tflex-direction: row;\n}\n\n.tc-flex-grow-1 {\n\tflex-grow: 1;\n}\n\n.tc-flex-grow-2 {\n\tflex-grow: 2;\n}\n\n/*\n** Other utility classes\n*/\n\n.tc-small-gap {\n\tmargin-left: .5em;\n\tmargin-right: .5em;\n}\n\n.tc-small-gap-left {\n\tmargin-left: .5em;\n}\n\n.tc-small-gap-right {\n\tmargin-right: .5em;\n}\n\n.tc-big-gap {\n\tmargin-left: 1em;\n\tmargin-right: 1em;\n}\n\n.tc-big-gap-left {\n\tmargin-left: 1em;\n}\n\n.tc-big-gap-right {\n\tmargin-right: 1em;\n}\n\n.tc-word-break {\n\tword-break: break-all;\n}\n"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/bodyfontsize":{"text":"15px"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/bodylineheight":{"text":"22px"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/fontsize":{"text":"14px"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/lineheight":{"text":"20px"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/storyleft":{"text":"0px"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/storytop":{"text":"0px"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/storyright":{"text":"770px"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/storywidth":{"text":"770px"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/tiddlerwidth":{"text":"686px"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/sidebarbreakpoint":{"text":"960px"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/sidebarwidth":{"text":"350px"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/options/stickytitles":{"text":"no"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/options/sidebarlayout":{"text":"fixed-fluid"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/options/codewrapping":{"text":"pre-wrap"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/reset":{"type":"text/plain","text":"/*! modern-normalize v1.0.0 | MIT License | https://github.com/sindresorhus/modern-normalize */\n\n/*\nDocument\n========\n*/\n\n/**\nUse a better box model (opinionated).\n*/\n\n*,\n*::before,\n*::after {\n  box-sizing: border-box;\n}\n\n/**\nUse a more readable tab size (opinionated).\n*/\n\n:root {\n  -moz-tab-size: 4;\n  tab-size: 4;\n}\n\n/**\n1. Correct the line height in all browsers.\n2. Prevent adjustments of font size after orientation changes in iOS.\n*/\n\nhtml {\n  line-height: 1.15; /* 1 */\n  -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; /* 2 */\n}\n\n/*\nSections\n========\n*/\n\n/**\nRemove the margin in all browsers.\n*/\n\nbody {\n  margin: 0;\n}\n\n/**\nImprove consistency of default fonts in all browsers. (https://github.com/sindresorhus/modern-normalize/issues/3)\n*/\n\nbody {\n  font-family:\n    system-ui,\n    -apple-system, /* Firefox supports this but not yet `system-ui` */\n    'Segoe UI',\n    Roboto,\n    Helvetica,\n    Arial,\n    sans-serif,\n    'Apple Color Emoji',\n    'Segoe UI Emoji';\n}\n\n/*\nGrouping content\n================\n*/\n\n/**\n1. Add the correct height in Firefox.\n2. Correct the inheritance of border color in Firefox. (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=190655)\n*/\n\nhr {\n  height: 0; /* 1 */\n  color: inherit; /* 2 */\n}\n\n/*\nText-level semantics\n====================\n*/\n\n/**\nAdd the correct text decoration in Chrome, Edge, and Safari.\n*/\n\nabbr[title] {\n  text-decoration: underline dotted;\n}\n\n/**\nAdd the correct font weight in Edge and Safari.\n*/\n\nb,\nstrong {\n  font-weight: bolder;\n}\n\n/**\n1. Improve consistency of default fonts in all browsers. (https://github.com/sindresorhus/modern-normalize/issues/3)\n2. Correct the odd 'em' font sizing in all browsers.\n*/\n\ncode,\nkbd,\nsamp,\npre {\n  font-family:\n    ui-monospace,\n    SFMono-Regular,\n    Consolas,\n    'Liberation Mono',\n    Menlo,\n    monospace; /* 1 */\n  font-size: 1em; /* 2 */\n}\n\n/**\nAdd the correct font size in all browsers.\n*/\n\nsmall {\n  font-size: 80%;\n}\n\n/**\nPrevent 'sub' and 'sup' elements from affecting the line height in all browsers.\n*/\n\nsub,\nsup {\n  font-size: 75%;\n  line-height: 0;\n  position: relative;\n  vertical-align: baseline;\n}\n\nsub {\n  bottom: -0.25em;\n}\n\nsup {\n  top: -0.5em;\n}\n\n/*\nTabular data\n============\n*/\n\n/**\n1. Remove text indentation from table contents in Chrome and Safari. (https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=999088, https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=201297)\n2. Correct table border color inheritance in all Chrome and Safari. (https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=935729, https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=195016)\n*/\n\ntable {\n  text-indent: 0; /* 1 */\n  border-color: inherit; /* 2 */\n}\n\n/*\nForms\n=====\n*/\n\n/**\n1. Change the font styles in all browsers.\n2. Remove the margin in Firefox and Safari.\n*/\n\nbutton,\ninput,\noptgroup,\nselect,\ntextarea {\n  font-family: inherit; /* 1 */\n  font-size: 100%; /* 1 */\n  line-height: 1.15; /* 1 */\n  margin: 0; /* 2 */\n}\n\n/**\nRemove the inheritance of text transform in Edge and Firefox.\n1. Remove the inheritance of text transform in Firefox.\n*/\n\nbutton,\nselect { /* 1 */\n  text-transform: none;\n}\n\n/**\nCorrect the inability to style clickable types in iOS and Safari.\n*/\n\nbutton,\n[type='button'],\n[type='reset'],\n[type='submit'] {\n  -webkit-appearance: button;\n}\n\n/**\nRemove the inner border and padding in Firefox.\n*/\n\n::-moz-focus-inner {\n  border-style: none;\n  padding: 0;\n}\n\n/**\nRestore the focus styles unset by the previous rule.\n*/\n\n:-moz-focusring {\n  outline: 1px dotted ButtonText;\n}\n\n/**\nRemove the additional ':invalid' styles in Firefox.\nSee: https://github.com/mozilla/gecko-dev/blob/2f9eacd9d3d995c937b4251a5557d95d494c9be1/layout/style/res/forms.css#L728-L737\n*/\n\n:-moz-ui-invalid {\n  box-shadow: none;\n}\n\n/**\nRemove the padding so developers are not caught out when they zero out 'fieldset' elements in all browsers.\n*/\n\nlegend {\n  padding: 0;\n}\n\n/**\nAdd the correct vertical alignment in Chrome and Firefox.\n*/\n\nprogress {\n  vertical-align: baseline;\n}\n\n/**\nCorrect the cursor style of increment and decrement buttons in Safari.\n*/\n\n::-webkit-inner-spin-button,\n::-webkit-outer-spin-button {\n  height: auto;\n}\n\n/**\n1. Correct the odd appearance in Chrome and Safari.\n2. Correct the outline style in Safari.\n*/\n\n[type='search'] {\n  -webkit-appearance: textfield; /* 1 */\n  outline-offset: -2px; /* 2 */\n}\n\n/**\nRemove the inner padding in Chrome and Safari on macOS.\n*/\n\n::-webkit-search-decoration {\n  -webkit-appearance: none;\n}\n\n/**\n1. Correct the inability to style clickable types in iOS and Safari.\n2. Change font properties to 'inherit' in Safari.\n*/\n\n::-webkit-file-upload-button {\n  -webkit-appearance: button; /* 1 */\n  font: inherit; /* 2 */\n}\n\n/*\nInteractive\n===========\n*/\n\n/*\nAdd the correct display in Chrome and Safari.\n*/\n\nsummary {\n  display: list-item;\n}\n"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/fontfamily":{"text":"system-ui, -apple-system, \"Segoe UI\", Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif, \"Apple Color Emoji\", \"Segoe UI Emoji\""},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/codefontfamily":{"text":"\"SFMono-Regular\",Consolas,\"Liberation Mono\",Menlo,Courier,monospace"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/backgroundimageattachment":{"text":"fixed"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/backgroundimagesize":{"text":"auto"},"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/sticky":{"text":"<$reveal state=\"$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/options/stickytitles\" type=\"match\" text=\"yes\">\n``\n.tc-tiddler-title {\n\tposition: -webkit-sticky;\n\tposition: -moz-sticky;\n\tposition: -o-sticky;\n\tposition: -ms-sticky;\n\tposition: sticky;\n\ttop: 0px;\n\tbackground: ``<<colour tiddler-background>>``;\n\tz-index: 500;\n}\n\n``\n<$list filter=\"[range[100]]\">\n`.tc-story-river .tc-tiddler-frame:nth-child(100n+`<$text text=<<currentTiddler>>/>`) {\nz-index: `<$text text={{{ [[200]subtract<currentTiddler>] }}}/>`;\n}\n`\n</$list>\n</$reveal>\n"}}}






650px

{
    "created": "20210328120810258",
    "text": "The web accessibility guidelines suggest a [[minimum contrast ratio|https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/visual-audio-contrast-contrast.html#key-terms]] of ''4.5'' for //small text//, and ''3.0'' for //large text//. When we audited color usage in our products, we discovered that none of the default text colors we were using for small text (except for black) met the contrast threshold.\n\n;Ref\n:[[https://stripe.com/blog/accessible-color-systems]]",
    "tags": "Concepts",

{
    "text": "\\define bgc()\nbackground-color:$(color)$;\ncolor:<<contrastcolour target:$(color)$ colourA:black colourB:white>>;\ndisplay:inline-block;width:20px;\ntext-align:center;\nvertical-align:middle;\n\\end\n\n\\define sample(color1:#000, color2:#fff, pct:0.5)\n<$vars color=<<blend $color1$ $color2$ percentage:$pct$>> >\n<$wikify name=b text=<<bgc>> >\n<span style=<<b>> ><small>&#215;</small> </span>\n</$wikify>\n</$vars>\n\\end\n\n\\define blend-colors(color, low:\"00\", high:\"100\")\n<div style=\"display:flex\">\n<div>\n<label style=\"display:inline-block;width:45px;\">Tint: </label><$list filter=\"[range[100, $low$,-10]]\" variable=pct><$macrocall $name=sample color1=#FFF color2=<<__color__>> pct=<<pct>> />\n</$list>\n<div>\n<div style=\"margin-top:4px;\">\n<label style=\"display:inline-block;width:45px;\">Shade: </label><$list filter=\"[range[0,$high$,10]]\" variable=pct><$macrocall $name=sample color1=<<__color__>> color2=#000 pct=<<pct>> /></$list>\n</div>\n</div>\n\\end\n\n\n!! Strip of shade and tint\n\nThe below examples show how to create a strip of colors. The example uses shade (mix with black) nd tint (mix with white).\n\nSee https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tints_and_shades\n\n\n<<<\n<<blend-colors color:\"#FFA500\">>\n<<blend-colors color:\"#800080\">>\n<<blend-colors color:\"#20B2AA\">>\n<<blend-colors color:\"#FF0000\">>\n<<blend-colors color:\"#00FF00\">>\n<<blend-colors color:\"#0000FF\">>\n<<<\n\n;Remaek\n:in tint, percent shows percent of color in mix of color+white\n:in shade, percent shows percent of black in mix of color+black\n\nSee [[Shade and Tints]]",

    "draft.of": "Color Blends Strip Demo with Percent 1"

Blend is created fro color: `#800080`\n\n<$macrocall $name=\"wikitext-example-without-html\" \nsrc=\"\"\"<<blend-colors-stripe color:\"#800080\" tidName:demo/stripe/sample01 indexName:main-color>>\n\nShow color value: ''{{demo/stripe/sample01##main-color}}''\n\"\"\"/>\n\n!!   <$list filter="[<tv-config-toolbar-text>match[yes]]">
    <span class="tc-btn-text">Switch colours</span>
  </$list>

  <$reveal type="match" state="$:/palette" text=<<darkPalette>>  > 
    <$action-setfield $tiddler="$:/palette"    text=<<lightPalette>> />
  </$reveal>
  <$reveal type="nomatch" state="$:/palette" text=<<darkPalette>>  >
    <$action-setfield $tiddler="$:/palette"         text=<<darkPalette>>  >
  </$reveal>
</$button>
</$vars>

{{$:/utility/ui/Button/SwitchPalette!!dark-palette}}






* Most color conversion JS code were from https://css-tricks.com/converting-color-spaces-in-javascript/ by Jon Kantner






Today is 12th, March 2021






{
    "mood-1": "#BE0F34",
    "mood-2": "#DCE5F4",
    "mood-3": "#FFFFFF",
    "mood-4": "#E5E5E5"
}






Today is 20th, March 2021

The background in primary selector sets the background color of inputboxes






{{$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/ui/select-color-scheme}}

<$macrocall $name=color-chooser paletteTid=test colorScheme={{{ [<tmpSelectScheme>get[text]]}}} />







\define setPalette()
<$vars newpalette={{{ [<tmpPaletteName>get[text]]}}}>
Set active color palette &nbsp;<$radio tiddler="$:/palette" field="text" value="$:/palettes/Vanilla" > Vanilla</$radio>
<$radio tiddler="$:/palette" field="text" value=<<newpalette>> > <<newpalette>></$radio>
</$vars>
\end


\define getPaletteName()
New palette &nbsp;<$edit-text tiddler=<<tmpPaletteName>> tag=input default="" placeholder="enter a name"/>
\end







\define color-chooser(paletteTid, colorScheme)
Search in selectors &nbsp;<$edit-text tiddler=<<tmpSearchTid>> tag=input default=""/>

<$radio tiddler=<<tmpRadioSelector>> field="text" value="[enlist<mainSelectors>sort[title]]" > main selectors</$radio>
<$radio tiddler=<<tmpRadioSelector>> field="text" value="[[$:/palettes/Vanilla]indexes[]sort[title]]"> all selectors</$radio>

<$vars searchTerm={{{[<tmpSearchTid>get[text]]}}} Selectors={{{[<tmpRadioSelector>get[text]]}}}>
<table>
<$list filter="[subfilter<Selectors>] +[search<searchTerm>]" variable=curIndex>
<tr>
<td><$text text=<<curIndex>> /></td> <td><$macrocall $name=setColor tidName=<<__paletteTid__>> indexName=<<curIndex>> /></td>
</tr>
</$list>
</table>
</$vars>
\end

\define setColor(tidName, indexName)
<$list filter="[<__colorScheme__>indexes[]]" variable=mood>
<$button class="tc-btn-invisible" setTitle=<<__tidName__>> setIndex=<<__indexName__>> setTo= {{{ [<__colorScheme__>getindex<mood>]}}} >
<$macrocall $name="circle" color={{{ [<__colorScheme__>getindex<mood>]}}} />
</$button>
</$list>
\end








!! Buttons
* <$button> simple button</$button>
* <$button class="tc-btn-invisible tc-tiddlylink"> button with tc-btn-invisible tc-tiddlylink classes</$button>







; Rev 0.9.2 - Apr 2nd, 2021
* [NEW] Selected color mood in Palette Studio shows a white ring to be recognized
* [NEW] Selected color for a CSS selector in color stripe shows a white cross sign inside to be recognized

; Rev 0.9.1 - Mar 30th, 2021
* [FIXED] minor bug in color viewtemplate
* [NEW] color contrast analyzer
* [NEW] JS macro to calculate the contrast ratio
* [NEW] Palette Browser (by Soren Bjornstad)


; Rev 0.9 - Mar 27th, 2021
* [NEW] JS macro to convert hex to rgb
* [NEW] RGBA Color tools
* [NEW] RGB Colors 
* [NEW] RGBA Colors 

; Rev 0.8 - Mar 26th, 2021
* [NEW] JS macro to convert rgb to hex
* [NEW] JS macro to convert rgba to hexa (#rrggbbaa)
* [NEW] JS macro to convert hex to hsl
* [NEW] JS macro to convert hexa (#rrggbbaa) to hsla
* [NEW] Wikitex macro to convert extended color name to hex
* [NEW] Wikitex macro to convert extended color name to hsl
* [NEW] HSLA Color tools shows checkerbox for transparency
* [NEW] HSLA Color tools now accpets the extended color names as input

; Rev 0.7 - Mar 25th, 2021
* [NEW] Create a save a new color
* [NEW] JS macros to convert hsla to rgba and hex codes
* [NEW] hsla and hsl color sliders to create new colors
* [NEW] All html extended colors were added. A sidebar tab has been added to select colors easily. Codes are copied to clipboard on click.
* [FIXED] number of colors is limited to 10 in color strip
* [FIXED] several bugs have been fixed

; Rev 0.6 - Mar 20th, 2021
* Improved and semantic UI for creating palettes
* Viewtemplate for color scheme tiddlers
* Better handling of input for creating new palette
* Bug fixes

; Rev 0.5 - Mar 17th, 2021
* Enhanced UI for creating palettes
* Direct switch to user created palette and reset to default palette
* More color schemes
* New UI to create color sccheme

; Rev 0.1 - Mar 12th, 2021
* new blend.js macro to make shades and tints
* new color stripe to choose color
* new 






{
    "mood-1": "#080706",
    "mood-2": "#EFEFEF",
    "mood-3": "#D1B280",
    "mood-4": "#594D46"
}






!! Code and Code block

This is a single `code` and this is a code block

```
def fun(x):
  return 2*x+1;
```  






\define bgc()
background-color:$(color)$;
color:<<contrastcolour target:$(color)$ colourA:black colourB:white>>;
display:inline-block;width:20px;
\end

\define sample(color1:#000, color2:#fff, pct:0.5)
<$vars color=<<blend $color1$ $color2$ percentage:$pct$>> >
<$wikify name=b text=<<bgc>> >
<span style=<<b>> >&nbsp;</span>
</$wikify>
</$vars>
\end

\define blend-colors(color, low:"20", high:"60")
<div style="display:flex">
<$list filter="[range[$low$,100,5]]" variable=pct><$macrocall $name=sample color1=#FFF color2=<<__color__>> pct=<<pct>> />
</$list><$list filter="[range[10,$high$,5]]" variable=pct><$macrocall $name=sample color1=<<__color__>> color2=#000 pct=<<pct>> /></$list>
</div>
\end


!! Strip of shade and tint

The below examples show how to create a strip of colors. The example uses shade (mix with black) nd tint (mix with white).

See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tints_and_shades

<<blend-colors color:"#FFA500">>
<<blend-colors color:"#800080">>
<<blend-colors color:"#20B2AA">>
<<blend-colors color:"#FF0000">>
<<blend-colors color:"#00FF00">>
<<blend-colors color:"#0000FF">>

;Remarks
:This code does not use button!






\define bgc()
background-color:$(color)$;
color:<<contrastcolour target:$(color)$ colourA:black colourB:white>>;
display:inline-block;width:20px;
\end

\define sample(color1:#000, color2:#fff, pct:0.5)
<$vars color=<<blend $color1$ $color2$ percentage:$pct$>> >
<$wikify name=b text=<<bgc>> >
<span style=<<b>> ><small><<pct>></small> </span>
</$wikify>
</$vars>
\end

\define blend-colors(color, low:"00", high:"100")
<div style="display:flex">
<div>
<label style="display:inline-block;width:45px;">Tint: </label><$list filter="[range[100, $low$,-10]]" variable=pct><$macrocall $name=sample color1=#FFF color2=<<__color__>> pct=<<pct>> />
</$list>
<div>
<div style="margin-top:4px;">
<label style="display:inline-block;width:45px;">Shade: </label><$list filter="[range[0,$high$,10]]" variable=pct><$macrocall $name=sample color1=<<__color__>> color2=#000 pct=<<pct>> /></$list>
</div>
</div>
\end


!! Strip of shade and tint

The below examples show how to create a strip of colors. The example uses shade (mix with black) nd tint (mix with white).

See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tints_and_shades


<<<
<<blend-colors color:"#FFA500">>
<<blend-colors color:"#800080">>
<<blend-colors color:"#20B2AA">>
<<blend-colors color:"#FF0000">>
<<blend-colors color:"#00FF00">>
<<blend-colors color:"#0000FF">>
<<<

;Remaek
:in tint, percent shows percent of color in mix of color+white
:in shade, percent shows percent of black in mix of color+black

See [[Shade and Tints]]






!! Strip of shade and tint

The below examples show how to create a strip of colors. The example uses shade (mix with black) nd tint (mix with white).

See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tints_and_shades

!! Example i
Click on the color strip and see the return color value. Blend is created fro color: `#800080`

<$macrocall $name="wikitext-example-without-html" 
src="""<<blend-colors-stripe color:"#800080" tidName:demo/stripe/sample01 indexName:main-color>>

Show color value: ''{{demo/stripe/sample01##main-color}}''
"""/>

!! Example ii
Click on the color strip and see the return color value. Blend is created fro color: `#9ACD32`.

<$macrocall $name="wikitext-example-without-html" 
src="""<<blend-colors-stripe color:"#9ACD32" tidName:demo/stripe/sample02 indexName:main-color>>

Show color value: ''{{demo/stripe/sample01##main-color}}''
"""/>







\define bgc()
background-color:$(color)$;
color:<<contrastcolour target:$(color)$ colourA:black colourB:white>>;
padding:5px; margin-bottom:0px;
font-weight:500;
\end

\define sample(color1:#000, color2:#fff, pct:0.5)
<$vars color=<<blend $color1$ $color2$ percentage:$pct$>> >
<$wikify name=b text=<<bgc>> >
<div style=<<b>> >
<$text text=<<color>> />
</div>
</$wikify>
</$vars>
\end

\define blend-colors(color, low:"10", high:"80")
<!-- 
 low: percentage of color in white 
 high: percentage of color in black
-->
<$list filter="[range[$low$,100,10]]" variable=pct>
<$macrocall $name=sample color1=#FFF color2=<<__color__>> pct=<<pct>> />
</$list>
<$list filter="[range[10,$high$,10]]" variable=pct>
<$macrocall $name=sample color1=<<__color__>> color2=#000 pct=<<pct>> />
</$list>
\end

This demo shows how `blend` macro generates a table of shades and tints of a given color.

<table>
<tr>
<$list filter="#FF0000 #00FF00 #0000FF #FFFF00 #40E0D0 #800080 #FFA500" variable=color>
<td><$macrocall $name=blend-colors color=<<color>> /></td>
</$list>
</tr>
</table>






\define copy-color-to-clipboard()
<$button class="tc-btn-invisible" style=<<b>> message="tm-copy-to-clipboard" param=<<color>> >
<$text text=<<color>> />
</$button>
\end


\define bgc()
background-color:$(color)$;
color:<<contrastcolour target:$(color)$ colourA:black colourB:white>>;
padding:5px; margin-bottom:0px;
font-weight:500;
width:80px;
\end

\define sample(color1:#000, color2:#fff, pct:0.5)
<$vars color=<<blend $color1$ $color2$ percentage:$pct$>> >
<$wikify name=b text=<<bgc>> >
<<copy-color-to-clipboard>>
</$wikify>
</$vars>
\end

\define blend-colors(color, low:"10", high:"80")
<!-- 
 low: percentage of color in white 
 high: percentage of color in black
-->
<$list filter="[range[$low$,100,10]]" variable=pct>
<$macrocall $name=sample color1=#FFF color2=<<__color__>> pct=<<pct>> />
</$list>
<$list filter="[range[10,$high$,10]]" variable=pct>
<$macrocall $name=sample color1=<<__color__>> color2=#000 pct=<<pct>> />
</$list>
\end

This demo shows how `blend` macro generates a table of shades and tints of a given color.

<table>
<tr>
<$list filter="#FF0000 #00FF00 #0000FF #FFFF00 #40E0D0 #800080 #FFA500" variable=color>
<td><$macrocall $name=blend-colors color=<<color>> /></td>
</$list>
</tr>
</table>







!! Convert HSL/HSLA to RGB/RGBA
<<<
<$macrocall $name="wikitext-example-without-html" 
src="""<<hsl2rgb 0 100 50>>
"""/>

<$macrocall $name="wikitext-example-without-html" 
src="""<<hsla2rgba 0 100 50 0.9>>
"""/>
<<<

!! Convert HSL/HSLA to Hex/Hex8
<<<
<$macrocall $name="wikitext-example-without-html" 
src="""- <<hsl2hex 0 100 50>>
"""/>

<$macrocall $name="wikitext-example-without-html" 
src="""- <<hsla2hexa 0 100 50 0.9>>
"""/>
<<<

!! Convert color name
<<<
<$macrocall $name="wikitext-example-without-html" 
src="""<<name2hex red>>
"""/>

<$macrocall $name="wikitext-example-without-html" 
src="""<<name2hsl Aqua>>
"""/>
<<<

!! Convert HEX/HEX8 to HSL/HSLA
<<<
<$macrocall $name="wikitext-example-without-html" 
src="""<<hex2hsl #FF0000>>
"""/>

<$macrocall $name="wikitext-example-without-html" 
src="""<<hexa2hsla #FF0000ff>>
"""/>
<<<

!! Convert RGB/RGBA to HEX/HEX8
<<<
<$macrocall $name="wikitext-example-without-html" 
src="""- <<rgb2hex 255 0 0>>
"""/>

<$macrocall $name="wikitext-example-without-html" 
src="""- <<rgba2hexa 255 102 125 0.5>>
"""/>
<<<

{{$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/ui/create-new-palette}}

---

''Edit and test user palette''

<$list filter="[<tmpPaletteName>get[text]minlength[1]]" variable=null emptyMessage="Select a user palette to edit">


{{$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/ui/switch-palette}}

<$macrocall $name=color-chooser-stripe paletteTid={{{ [<tmpPaletteName>get[text]] }}} colorScheme={{{ [<tmpSelectScheme>get[text]] }}} />

</$list>






\define newColorScheme()
<$action-createtiddler $basetitle=<<scTitle>>  tags="scheme" type="application/json" description=<<scDescription>> />
<$list filter="[range[1,$(numColorMoods)$]]" variable=num>
<$action-setfield $tiddler=<<scTitle>> text={{{ [<tmpTid>get[text]] }}} />
</$list>
<$action-deletetiddler $tiddler=<<tmpTid>> />
\end

\define tmpTid() xx$:/temp/color-scheme  
\define numColorMoods() 4

\define dispcolor() 
<$list filter="[<colorScheme>indexes[]]" variable=mood>
<$macrocall $name=circle color={{{[<colorScheme>getindex<mood>]}}} />
</$list>
\end

\define setMood(schemeTiddler)
<$list filter="[range[1,$(numColorMoods)$]]" variable=num>
<$edit-text tiddler=<<__schemeTiddler__>> index={{{ [[mood-]addsuffix<num>] }}}  type="color" tag=input />
</$list>
\end

''Create color scheme''

A color scheme is the choice of colors used for design context. All elements get their colors in form of shades, tints and tones of these main colors.

<div class="colorplay">
<label for="title">Title: </label>
	<$edit-text tiddler=<<tmpTid>> field=name tag=input default=""/>
</div>
<div class="colorplay">
	<label for="description">Description: </label>
	<$edit-text tiddler=<<tmpTid>> field=description tag=input default=""/>
</div>
<div class="colorplay">
    <label for="moods">Color moods: </label>
	<$macrocall $name=setMood  schemeTiddler=<<tmpTid>> numMoods=<<numColorMoods>> />
</div>  


<$vars scTitle={{{ [<tmpTid>get[name]] }}}
   scDescription={{{ [<tmpTid>get[description]] }}}
   disabled={{{[<tmpTid>get[name]!is[blank]then[no]else[yes]] }}} >
	<div class="colorplay">
		<$button actions=<<newColorScheme>> disabled=<<disabled>>>Create</$button>    
	</div>
</$vars>


''Color schemes''


<table>
<$list filter="[tag[scheme]]" variable=colorScheme>
<tr>
<td><$link to=<<colorScheme>> /></td>
<td><<dispcolor>></td>
</tr>
</$list>
</table>








This section conatins

<<list-links "[tag<currentTiddler>]">>






Demo and example of [[coloraction plugin|$:/plugins/telmiger/ColorAction]]:

<<list-links "[tag[coloraction]]">>






\define show(bcolor, min, max, inc)
<$range tiddler=<<tmpTid>> min="$min$" max="$max$" increment="$inc$" class=radioClass/> <$text text={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}}/>

<$macrocall $name=colorbox 
  newcolor="""<$macrocall $name=coloraction color="$bcolor$" mod="brighten" value={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}} action=toHexString/>"""
  />
\end


<<show bcolor:"#ff0000" min:0 max:100 inc:10>>


;Remarks
: works with rgb function
: works with hex color code






\define show(bcolor)

<$macrocall $name=colorbox 
  newcolor="""<$macrocall $name=coloraction color="$bcolor$" mod="complement" value={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}} action=toHexString/>"""
  />
\end


Example of complement

<$list filter="red blue green yellow black white purple " variable=currentColor>
<$macrocall $name=show bcolor=<<currentColor>> />
</$list>

!! With alpha
Complement with alpha=0.3

<<show bcolor:"rgba(200, 20, 20, .3)">>






\define show(bcolor, min, max, inc)
<$range tiddler=<<tmpTid>> min="$min$" max="$max$" increment="$inc$" class=radioClass/> <$text text={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}}/>

<$macrocall $name=colorbox 
  newcolor="""<$macrocall $name=coloraction color="$bcolor$" mod="darken" value={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}} action=toHexString/>"""
  />
\end



<<show bcolor:"#ff0000" min:0 max:50 inc:5>>


;Remarks
: works with rgb function
: works with hex color code






\define show(bcolor, min, max, inc)
<$range tiddler=<<tmpTid>> min="$min$" max="$max$" increment="$inc$" class=radioClass/> <$text text={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}}/>

<$macrocall $name=colorbox 
  newcolor="""<$macrocall $name=coloraction color="$bcolor$" mod="desaturate" value={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}} action=toHexString/>"""
  />
\end

Saturate

<<show bcolor:"rgb(204, 102, 102)" min:0 max:100 inc:10>>


;Remarks
: works with rgb function
: works with hex color code






\define show(bcolor, min, max, inc)
<$range tiddler=<<tmpTid>> min="$min$" max="$max$" increment="$inc$" class=radioClass/> <$text text={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}}/>

<$macrocall $name=colorbox 
  newcolor="""<$macrocall $name=coloraction color="$bcolor$" mod="lighten" value={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}} action=toHexString/>"""
  />
\end



<<show bcolor:"#ff0000" min:0 max:100 inc:10>>


;Remarks
: works with rgb function
: works with hex color code






\define show(bcolor, min, max, inc)
<$range tiddler=<<tmpTid>> min="$min$" max="$max$" increment="$inc$" class=radioClass/> <$text text={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}}/>

<$macrocall $name=colorbox 
  newcolor="""<$macrocall $name=coloraction color="$bcolor$" mod="black" value={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}} action=mix/>"""
  />
\end

Mixing colors

<<show "yellow" min:0 max:100 inc:5>>

This example mixes with black








\define show(bcolor, min, max, inc)
<$range tiddler=<<tmpTid>> min="$min$" max="$max$" increment="$inc$" class=radioClass/> <$text text={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}}/>

<$macrocall $name=colorbox 
  newcolor="""<$macrocall $name=coloraction color="$bcolor$" mod="saturate" value={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}} action=toHexString/>"""
  />
\end

Saturate

<<show bcolor:"rgb(99, 100, 100)" min:0 max:100 inc:10>>


;Remarks
: works with all colors, but it is important what you pass






\define show(bcolor, min, max, inc)
<$range tiddler=<<tmpTid>> min="$min$" max="$max$" increment="$inc$" class=radioClass/> <$text text={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}}/>

<$macrocall $name=colorbox 
  newcolor="""<$macrocall $name=coloraction color="$bcolor$" mod="spin" value={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}} action=toHexString/>"""
  />
\end

Spin color wheel

<<show "yellow" min:0 max:360 inc:10>>









\define tmpTid() xx$:/temp/$(currentTiddler)$/color-value

\define colorBoxStyle()
background-color:$(color)$;
color:<<contrastcolour target:$(color)$ colourA:black colourB:white>>;
\end

\define colorbox(newcolor)
<$wikify name=color text=<<__newcolor__>> >
<$wikify name=divstyle text=<<colorBoxStyle>> >
  <div class="colorbox" style=<<divstyle>> >
	<$text text=<<color>> />
  </div>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
\end






This section conatins

<<list-links "[tag<currentTiddler>]">>






<<tree $:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/>>






<<dbadge Tiddlywiki 5.1.23+ primary>> <<dbadge License MIT success>> <<dbadge Release "{{$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay!!version}} 0.9" warning>> <<dbadge Status "In progress" danger>>






* Colour Contrast Checker: https://colourcontrast.cc/010101/a9a9a9/
* Web AIM Contrast Checker: https://webaim.org/resources/contrastchecker/
* A wonderful contrast checker
** code: https://github.com/leaverou/contrast-ratio
** demo: [[https://contrast-ratio.com/#]] [5 Stars]
* Color contrsat tools: https://www.webaxe.org/color-contrast-tools/
* https://color-contrast-checker.deque.com/ (enter you color scheme and it produces all combinations)






A colour palette is a [[data tiddler|https://tiddlywiki.com/#DataTiddlers]] that supplies a CSS colour value, such as ''yellow'' or ''#fe0'', for each of several colour names, like this:

```
page-background: #fe0
table-border: #ccc
...
```

Several palettes form part of the core. The system tiddler [[$:/palette]] always contains the title of the currently selected palette tiddler. You can change a palette using the <<.icon $:/core/images/palette>> ''palette'' button, found on the "Tools" tab in the sidebar.

To retrieve the value of a named colour from the current palette, e.g. for use in a stylesheet tiddler, use the <<.mlink colour>> macro:

```
<<colour page-background>>
```

Palette tiddlers should have the following fields:

|!Name |!Value |
|title |Typically starting with `$:/` |
|type |`application/x-tiddler-dictionary` |
|tags |`$:/tags/Palette` |
|name |Displayed in the palette browser |
|description |Displayed in the palette browser |
|text |`name: value` colour definitions |







This section conatins

<<list-links "[tag<currentTiddler>]">>






\import [all[tiddlers+shadows]tag[$:/tags/Macro/Toc]]

<<toc-ui tag:"contents" stateTiddler:"20210328143800">>












\import [all[tiddlers+shadows]tag[$:/tags/Macro/Toc]]
<!-- customized class is used for buttons -->
<style>
.colorful-btns{color:dodgerblue;}
</style>
<!-- Call navigator -->
<<multilevel-toc-navigation tag:"contents" close:"yes" class:"kk-toc-navigation colorful-btns" stateTiddler:"20210328143800">>






Color 1 (Hex): <$edit-text tiddler="xx$:/temp/hexcolors" field=hex1 tag=input defualt=""/><br>

Color 2 (Hex): <$edit-text tiddler="xx$:/temp/hexcolors" field=hex2 tag=input defualt=""/>

<small>Only three or six digits hex color accepted. No opacity can be evaluated</small>

<$macrocall $name=contrastbox fcolor={{xx$:/temp/hexcolors!!hex1}} bcolor={{xx$:/temp/hexcolors!!hex2}} />


<table>
<tr><th>Criteria</th><th>Results</th></tr>

<$wikify name=ratio text="""<$macrocall $name=contrast hex1={{xx$:/temp/hexcolors!!hex1}} hex2={{xx$:/temp/hexcolors!!hex2}}/>""" >
<$list filter="[<ratio>!is[blank]]" emptyMessage="<tr><td colspan=2>wrong colors input</td></tr>">
<tr><td>value</td><td><$text text={{{[[1]divide<ratio>fixed[2]]}}} /></td></tr>
<tr>
<td>AA-level large text (3:1)</td>
<td><$list filter="[<ratio>compare:number:lt[0.33333]]" emptyMessage="FAIL">PASS</$list></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>AA-level small text  (4.5:1)</td>
<td><$list filter="[<ratio>compare:number:lt[0.22222]]" emptyMessage="FAIL">PASS</$list></td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td>AAA-level large text (4.5:1)</td>
<td><$list filter="[<ratio>compare:number:lt[0.22222]]" emptyMessage="FAIL">PASS</$list></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>AAA-level small text (7:1)</td>
<td><$list filter="[<ratio>compare:number:lt[0.14285]]" emptyMessage="FAIL">PASS</$list></td>
</tr>
</$list>
</$wikify>
</table>


<<details sum:"WCAG Levels for Readability" src:"{{WCAG Levels for Readability}}">>


;Other tiddlers
: [[macros/contrast-box]]






;Inspect element in Chrome/Edge
The contrast ratio of the text (how well, or how poorly, does the foreground text contrast with the background color) can be checked using the Chrome/Edge inspect element of DevTools

<<image-pretty img:"Inspect Element of DevTools.png" width:400px caption:"Inspect Element of ~DevTools Chrome/Edge browsers" align:right>>

Here’s how it works. When you use Inspect Element — what is arguably the most common use of DevTools — you now get a tooltip with additional information on accessibility.



;Ref
:https://css-tricks.com/whats-new-in-devtools-2020/#a-better-inspect-element

\define tmpTid() temp/$(currentTiddler)$/$(color1)$

\define bgc()
background-color:$(color)$;
color:<<contrastcolour target:$(color)$ colourA:black colourB:white>>;
padding:5px; margin-bottom:0px;
font-weight:500;
\end

\define sample(color1:"#000", color2:"#fff", pct:0.5)
<$vars color=<<blend $color1$ $color2$ percentage:$pct$>> >
<$wikify name=b text=<<bgc>> >
<div style=<<b>> >
<$text text=<<color>> />
</div>
</$wikify>
</$vars>
\end

\define show(colorScheme)
<$list filter="[[$colorScheme$]indexes[]]" variable=color>
<$vars color1={{{[[$colorScheme$]getindex<color>]}}}>
<$vars pct={{{ [<tmpTid>get[text]] }}} >
<$range tiddler=<<tmpTid>> min="0" max="100" default="0" increment="1" class=cls/> <$text text=<<pct>> />
<$macrocall $name=sample color1=<<color1>> color2="#000" pct=<<pct>> />
</$vars></$vars>
</$list>
\end

!!Warm Pastels and Nile Blue
<<show "Warm Pastels and Nile Blue">>


!!Shades of Purple
<<show "Shades of Purple">>
<style>
.cls{width:50%}
</style>






\define cc() color:<<hsla2hex 0 100 50 0.33>>;
<div style="background-color:white">
<div style="padding:20px;text-align:center;font-weight:500;
background-color:hsla(0, 100%, 50%, 0.33)">
TEST
</div>
</div>

-<<hsla2hex 0 100 50 0.33>>

<div style="background-color:white">
<div style=<<cc>> >
TEST
</div>
</div>

Every modern web browser includes a powerful suite of developer tools. These tools do a range of things, from inspecting currently-loaded HTML, CSS and JavaScript to showing which assets the page has requested and how long they took to load. This article explains how to use the basic functions of your browser's devtools.

{{Colorplay Status}}

; Colors are fun to play
<div style="float:right;width:64px">{{$:/favicon.ico}}</div>

Color play has tools and demos for working with colors and palettes in Tiddlywiki. It can be used to

* create new colors
* work with html extended color names
* create new palettes
* edit current user palettes
* explore in all css selectors and colors 

To give a try, get your hands on [[Color Palette Studio]]


;Remark
: To edit and customize the core palettes first create a clone and tag it with `colorplay`.


;Export and share
: Create a new palette
: Customize colors as much as you like
: Drag and drop the newly created palette to your wiki of choice
: You can also [[Export and Share]] with others


<<details sum:"Change log" src:"""{{Change Logs}}""">>






HSL stands for hue, saturation, and lightness.

!!HSL Color Values

HSLA color values are an extension of HSL with an Alpha channel (opacity).
In HTML, a color can be specified using ''hue'', ''saturation'', and ''lightness'' (HSL) in the form:

```
hsl(hue, saturation, lightness)
```

* ''Hue'' is a degree on the color wheel from 0 to 360. 0 is red, 120 is green, and 240 is blue.

* ''Saturation'' is a percentage value, 0% means a shade of gray, and 100% is the full color.

* ''Lightness'' is also a percentage value, 0% is black, and 100% is white.

;Some color codes
:Hue is specified in degrees (imagine a color wheel) where 0° – red, 60° – yellow, 120° – green, 180° – turquoise, 240° – blue, 300° – pink, and 360° – red


!! HSLA Color Values

HSLA color values are an extension of HSL color values with an ''Alpha'' channel - which specifies the opacity for a color.

An HSLA color value is specified with:

```
hsla(hue, saturation, lightness, alpha)
```

* The ''alpha'' parameter is a number between 0.0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (not transparent at all).



;Ref
:[[w3school|https://www.w3schools.com/htmL/html_colors_hsl.asp]]








\define tmpTid() xx$:/temp/hsl

\define hslcolor() hsl($(hue)$, $(saturation)$%, $(lightness)$%)
\define hexcolor() <<hsl2hex $(hue)$ $(saturation)$ $(lightness)$>>
\define rgbcolor() <<hsl2rgb $(hue)$ $(saturation)$ $(lightness)$>>
\define divstyle() 
background-color:$(hslcolor)$;
color:<<contrastcolour target:"$(hslcolor)$" colourA:black colourB:white>>;
\end


\define copy-color-to-clipboard(color)
<$button class="btn btn-sm" style=<<dstyle>> message="tm-copy-to-clipboard" param="$color$" >
<$text text="$color$" />
</$button>
\end

<!-- display the hue, saturation, lightness and alpha slider -->
{{$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/ui/hsl-sliders}}

<div style="width:400px;max-width:100%;">

<$vars hue={{{[<tmpTid>get[hue]]}}}
       saturation={{{[<tmpTid>get[saturation]]}}}
       lightness={{{[<tmpTid>get[lightness]]}}} >

<$wikify name=dstyle text=<<divstyle>> >
<div class="colorplay-colorbox" style=<<dstyle>>>
<<hslcolor>>
</div>
</$wikify>

<!-- buttons to copy the color -->
<small>Click to copy to clipboard</small>

<$macrocall $name=copy-color-to-clipboard color=<<hslcolor>> />

<$wikify name=HexColor text=<<hexcolor>> >
<$macrocall $name=copy-color-to-clipboard color={{{[<HexColor>addprefix[#]]}}} />
</$wikify>

<$wikify name=RgbColor text=<<rgbcolor>> >
<$macrocall $name=copy-color-to-clipboard color=<<RgbColor>> />
</$wikify>


</$vars>

</div>



<<details sum:"HSL and HSLA Color Values" src:"{{HSL and HSLA Color Values}}" status:closed labelClass:"bg-secondary text-white">>

<<colorbox2 "hsl(0, 100%, 0%)">>

<<colorbox2 "hsl(0, 100%, 25%)">>

<<colorbox2 "hsl(0, 100%, 50%)">>

<<colorbox2 "hsl(0, 100%, 75%)">>

<<colorbox2 "hsl(0, 100%, 90%)">>

<<colorbox2 "hsl(0, 100%, 100%)">>

</div>






<div style="display:flex; max-width:100%; flex-wrap: wrap; flex-direction: row;">

<<colorbox2 "hsl(0, 0%, 20%)">>

<<colorbox2 "hsl(0, 0%, 30%)">>

<<colorbox2 "hsl(0, 0%, 40%)">>

<<colorbox2 "hsl(0, 0%, 60%)">>

<<colorbox2 "hsl(0, 0%, 70%)">>

<<colorbox2 "hsl(0, 0%, 90%)">>

</div>






\define tmpTid() xx$:/temp/color-name-to-hsla

\define select-extended-colors(tmpTid:"xx$:/temp/colorname")
<$select tiddler=<<__tmpTid__>> default='aliceblue' actions=<<myactions>> >
<$list filter="[[$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/data/extended-color-names]indexes[]]">
<option value=<<currentTiddler>>><$view field='title'/></option>
</$list>
\end

\define myactions()
<$wikify name=hexcolor text="""<$macrocall $name=name2hex color={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}} />""">
<$wikify name=hslcolor text="""<$macrocall $name=hex2hsl H=<<hexcolor>> />""" >
<$vars h={{{[<hslcolor>split[,]nth[1]removeprefix[hsl(]]}}} 
       s={{{[<hslcolor>split[,]nth[2]removesuffix[%]]}}}
       l={{{[<hslcolor>split[,]nth[3]removesuffix[%)]]}}} >

<$action-setfield $tiddler=<<tmpHslaTid>> $field="hue" $value=<<h>>/>
<$action-setfield $tiddler=<<tmpHslaTid>> $field="saturation" $value=<<s>>/>
<$action-setfield $tiddler=<<tmpHslaTid>> $field="lightness" $value=<<l>>/>
<$action-setfield $tiddler=<<tmpHslaTid>> $field="alpha" $value=1.0 />

</$vars>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
\end


Choose a color from the list of html extended color names and edit it using the HSLA color tools.
<br>

<$vars tmpHslaTid="xx$:/temp/new">

Select an extended color name: <$macrocall $name=select-extended-colors tmpTid=<<tmpTid>> />


{{HSLA Colors}}
</$vars>






\define hslacolor() hsla($(hue)$, $(saturation)$%, $(lightness)$%, $(alpha)$)
\define hexcolor()  <<hsla2hexa $(hue)$ $(saturation)$ $(lightness)$ $(alpha)$>>
\define rgbacolor() <<hsla2rgba $(hue)$ $(saturation)$ $(lightness)$ $(alpha)$>>
\define divstyle() 
background-color:$(hslacolor)$;
color:<<contrastcolour target:"$(hslacolor)$" colourA:black colourB:white>>;
\end


\define copy-color-to-clipboard(color)
<$button class="btn btn-sm" style=<<dstyle>> message="tm-copy-to-clipboard" param="$color$" >
<$text text="$color$" />
</$button>
\end


\define createNewColor()
<$action-createtiddler $basetitle="New Color" $savetitle=<<saveTid>> tags=color
hexcolor=<<HexColor>> hslacolor=<<hslacolor>> rgbacolor=<<RgbaColor>>/>
<$action-navigate $to={{{[<saveTid>get[text]]}}} $scroll=yes/>
\end



<!-- display the hue, saturation, lightness and alpha slider -->
{{$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/ui/hsla-sliders}}



<$vars hue={{{[<tmpHslaTid>get[hue]]}}}
       saturation={{{[<tmpHslaTid>get[saturation]]}}}
       lightness={{{[<tmpHslaTid>get[lightness]]}}}
       alpha={{{[<tmpHslaTid>get[alpha]]}}} >

<div class=colorbox-container>
<$wikify name=dstyle text=<<divstyle>> >
<div class="colorplay-colorbox" style=<<dstyle>> >
<<hslacolor>>
</div>
</$wikify>
</div>


<!-- buttons to copy the color -->
<small>Click to copy to clipboard</small>

<$macrocall $name=copy-color-to-clipboard color=<<hslacolor>> />

<$wikify name=HexColor text=<<hexcolor>> >

<$macrocall $name=copy-color-to-clipboard color={{{[<HexColor>addprefix[#]]}}} />

<$wikify name=RgbaColor text=<<rgbacolor>> >

<$macrocall $name=copy-color-to-clipboard color=<<RgbaColor>> />

<$button class="btn btn-sm" actions=<<createNewColor>> >
''Create Color Tiddler''
</$button>

</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$vars>


<<details sum:"HSL and HSLA Color Values" src:"{{HSL and HSLA Color Values}}" status:closed labelClass:"bg-secondary text-white">>






<div style="display:flex; max-width:100%; flex-wrap: wrap; flex-direction: row;">

<<colorbox2 "hsla(9, 100%, 64%, 0)">>

<<colorbox2 "hsla(9, 100%, 64%, 0.2)">>

<<colorbox2 "hsla(9, 100%, 64%, 0.4)">>

<<colorbox2 "hsla(9, 100%, 64%, 0.6)">>

<<colorbox2 "hsla(9, 100%, 64%, 0.8)">>

<<colorbox2 "hsla(9, 100%, 64%, 1)">>

</div>






\define copy-color-to-clipboard()
<$button class="tc-btn-invisible" style=<<b>> message="tm-copy-to-clipboard" param=<<color>> >
<$text text=<<color>> />
</$button>
\end


\define bgc()
background-color:$(color)$;
color:<<contrastcolour target:$(color)$ colourA:black colourB:white>>;
padding:5px; margin-bottom:0px;
font-weight:500;
width:80px;
margin:2px;
\end

\define dispcolor()
<$wikify name=b text=<<bgc>> >
<<copy-color-to-clipboard>>
</$wikify>
\end


Html5 extended color names

For shades and tints see [[HTML Extended Colors Shades and Tints]]
<br>

Search in name &nbsp;<$edit-text tiddler="xx$:/temp/$(currentTiddler)$/filter-extended-colors" tag=input defualt=""/>

<small>Click on color code to copy to clipboard<br></small>
<table>
<tr>
<th style="width:150px;">Color name</th>
<th>Hex code</th>
</tr>
<$vars filtercolorname={{{[[xx$:/temp/$(currentTiddler)$/filter-extended-colors]get[text]]}}}>
<$list filter="[[$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/data/extended-color-names]indexes[]] +[search<filtercolorname>]">
<tr>
<td><$view field=title/></td>
<$vars color={{{[[$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/data/extended-color-names]getindex<currentTiddler>]}}} >
<td><<dispcolor>></td>
</$vars>
</tr>
</$list>
</$vars>
</table>






\define copy-color-to-clipboard()
<$button class="tc-btn-invisible" style=<<b>> message="tm-copy-to-clipboard" param=<<color>> >
<$text text=<<color>> />
</$button>
\end


\define bgc()
background-color:$(color)$;
color:<<contrastcolour target:$(color)$ colourA:black colourB:white>>;
padding:5px; margin-bottom:0px;
font-weight:500;
width:80px;
margin:2px;
\end

\define sample(color1:#000, color2:#fff, pct:0.5)
<$vars color=<<blend $color1$ $color2$ percentage:$pct$>> >
<$wikify name=b text=<<bgc>> >
<<copy-color-to-clipboard>>
</$wikify>
</$vars>
\end

\define blend-colors(color, low:"10", high:"80")
<!-- 
 low: percentage of color in white 
 high: percentage of color in black
-->
<$list filter="[range[$low$,100,10]]" variable=pct>
<$macrocall $name=sample color1=#FFF color2=<<__color__>> pct=<<pct>> />
</$list>
<$list filter="[range[10,$high$,10]]" variable=pct>
<$macrocall $name=sample color1=<<__color__>> color2=#000 pct=<<pct>> />
</$list>
\end


!! Shades and tints of html5 extended colors
This demo shows the shades and tints of html5 extended colors.

<small>Click on color code to copy to clipboard</small>


<$vars tmpTid="xx$:/temp/color-name">

<$macrocall $name=select-extended-colors tmpTid=<<tmpTid>> /> 

<$vars colorname={{{ [<tmpTid>get[text]] }}}>
<$vars colorcode={{{[[$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/data/extended-color-names]getindex<colorname>]}}} >
<$macrocall $name=blend-colors color=<<colorcode>> />

</$vars>
</$vars>
</$vars>

See [[Shade and Tints]]






{
    "mood-1": "#F1F1F2",
    "mood-2": "#BCBABE",
    "mood-3": "#A1D6E2",
    "mood-4": "#1995AD"
}

* Text area
<$edit-text tiddler="$:/temp/sample-tiddler" tag=textarea default="empty ..."/>

/*\
title: macros/addx
type: application/javascript
module-type: macro

Resolves a relative path for an absolute rootpath.

\*/
(function(){

/*jslint node: true, browser: true */
/*global $tw: false */
"use strict";

exports.name = "addx";

exports.params = [
	{name: "a"},
	{name: "b"}   
];

/*
Run the macro
*/
exports.run = function(a, b) {
  return Number(a) + Number(b);
};

})();







\define tmpTid() xx$:/temp/$(currentTiddler)$/color-value

\define colorBoxStyle()
background-color:$(color)$;
color:<<contrastcolour target:$(color)$ colourA:black colourB:white>>;
\end

\define colorbox2(newcolor)
<div class=colorbox-container>
<$wikify name=color text=<<__newcolor__>> >
<$wikify name=divstyle text=<<colorBoxStyle>> >
  <div class="colorplay-colorbox" style=<<divstyle>> >
	<$text text=<<color>> />
  </div>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</div>
\end






\define contrastBoxStyle()
background-color:$(bcolor)$;
color:$(fcolor)$;
border:1px solid black;
padding:10px;
min-width:360px;
\end

\define contrastbox(fcolor, bcolor)
<$vars fcolor=<<__fcolor__>> bcolor=<<__bcolor__>> >
<$wikify name=divstyle text=<<contrastBoxStyle>> >
<div class="colorbox" style=<<divstyle>> >
  $fcolor$ on $bcolor$
</div>
</$wikify>
</$vars>
\end






\define select-extended-colors(tmpTid:"xx$:/temp/colorname")
<$select tiddler=<<__tmpTid__>> default='aliceblue'>
<$list filter="[[$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/data/extended-color-names]indexes[]]">
<option value=<<currentTiddler>>><$view field='title'/></option>
</$list>
\end






{
    "mood-1": "#E91E63",
    "mood-2": "#00BCD4",
    "mood-3": "#FFEB3B",
    "mood-4": "#607D8B"
}
























Today is 17th, March 2021

* create new ui for create color scheme
* see [[Color Schemes]]






\define colorsplotch(col)
	<div class="color-splotch" style="background: $col$;">
\end

\define copy-hex() <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-copy-to-clipboard" $param=<<hexvalue>>/>
\define copy-mac() <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-copy-to-clipboard" $param="""<<color $(currentTiddler)$>>"""/>

<div style="text-align: center;">Current palette: <$link to={{$:/palette}}/></div>

<table>
	<tr>
		<th></th>
		<th>Hex Color Code</th>
		<th>~TiddlyWiki CSS Selector</th>
		<th>Copy to clipboard</th>
	</tr>
<$list filter="[{$:/palette}indexes[]]">
	<$list filter="[{$:/palette}getindex<currentTiddler>]" variable="hexvalue">
		<tr>
			<td><$macrocall $name=colorsplotch col=<<hexvalue>>/></td>
			<td><<hexvalue>></td>
		  <td><<currentTiddler>></td>
			<td>
				<$button class="tc-tiddlylink tc-btn-invisible" actions=<<copy-mac>>> macro def</$button> -- 
				<$button class="tc-tiddlylink tc-btn-invisible" actions=<<copy-hex>>>hex code</$button>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</$list>
</$list>
</table>

<style>
.color-splotch {
	float: left;
	width: 20px;
	height: 20px;
	border: 1px solid #000000;
	margin: 0;
}
</style>


;Ref
:{{!!author}} - <a href={{!!url}} target=_blank>Google Group</a>






Today is 15th, March 2021

The color of table of palette in control panel

* background: table header background
* foreground: primary (note they are links)






{
    "mood-1": "#375E97",
    "mood-2": "#FB6542",
    "mood-3": "#FFBB00",
    "mood-4": "#3F681C"
}






!! Quotes
> This is a single quote

This is a block quote

<<<
<<.lorem>>
<<<







\define colorTest(test:"Blank test", fcolor:"black", bcolor:"white")

<$wikify name=color1 text=<<__fcolor__>>  >
<$wikify name=color2 text=<<__bcolor__>>  >

<$wikify name="style" text="color: $fcolor$; background-color: $bcolor$;">

<div class="cls" title=<<colorstitle>> style=<<style>> >

<label>$test$: </label> <$macrocall $name=coloraction color=<<color2>> mod=<<color1>> action="getReadability"/>
<label>Contrast ratio </label> <$macrocall $name=coloraction color=<<color2>> mod=<<color1>> action="getReadability"/>
</div>

</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
\end

<style>
.cls{
padding:10px;
}
</style>
<<colorTest>>

<$macrocall $name=colorTest fcolor="rgb(255,128,0)" bcolor=<<coulor page-background>> />

<$macrocall $name=colorTest fcolor="hsl(0,100%,50%)" bcolor="rgb(255,255,0)" />

<!-- !!! colorTest Macro

colorTest(test,color1,color2)

* test: a name
* color1: foreground
* color2: background

!!!! style where used 

e.g. like this: 

```
<style>
.css-test { <<.pa2>> <<.ba>> display: flex; }
.css-test .css-test-name { font-weight: 600; }
.css-test .contrast { font-weight: 500;  }
</style>
```

!!!! Dependency

This macro uses the ColorAction Plugin from https://tid.li/tw5/plugins.html

-->






!! Practices and theories

!! Recent discussion on GG (correct fr links)
* https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/#inbox/KtbxLwGrWGsWQSlRmVrthCrFPtsxdvdpvV






An RGB color value represents ''RED'', ''GREEN'', and ''BLUE'' light sources.

An RGBA color value is an extension of RGB with an ''Alpha'' channel (opacity).

!!RGB Color Values

In HTML, a color can be specified as an RGB value, using this formula:

```
rgb(red, green, blue)
```

Each parameter (''red'', ''green'', and ''blue'') defines the intensity of the color with a value between 0 and 255.

This means that there are 256 x 256 x 256 = ''16777216'' possible colors!

* For example, rgb(255, 0, 0) is displayed as red, because red is set to its highest value (255), and the other two (green and blue) are set to 0.
* Another example, rgb(0, 255, 0) is displayed as green, because green is set to its highest value (255), and the other two (red and blue) are set to 0.
* To display black, set all color parameters to 0, like this: rgb(0, 0, 0).
* To display white, set all color parameters to 255, like this: rgb(255, 255, 255).

!! RGBA Color Values
RGBA color values are an extension of RGB color values with an ''Alpha'' channel - which specifies the opacity for a color.

An RGBA color value is specified with:

```
rgba(red, green, blue, alpha)
```

The alpha parameter is a number between 0.0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (not transparent at all):


;Ref
:[[w3school|https://www.w3schools.com/htmL/html_colors_rgb.asp]]






\define tmpTid() xx$:/temp/rgb

\define rgbcolor() rgb($(red)$, $(green)$, $(blue)$)
\define hslcolor() <<rgb2hsl $(red)$ $(green)$ $(blue)$>>
\define hexcolor() <<rgb2hex $(red)$ $(green)$ $(blue)$>>

\define divstyle() 
background-color:$(rgbcolor)$;
color:<<contrastcolour target:"$(rgbcolor)$" colourA:black colourB:white>>;
\end


\define copy-color-to-clipboard(color)
<$button class="btn btn-sm" style=<<dstyle>> message="tm-copy-to-clipboard" param="$color$" >
<$text text="$color$" />
</$button>
\end

<!-- display the rgb sliders -->
{{$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/ui/rgb-sliders}}

<div style="width:400px;max-width:100%;">

<$vars red={{{[<tmpTid>get[red]]}}}
       green={{{[<tmpTid>get[green]]}}}
       blue={{{[<tmpTid>get[blue]]}}} >

<$wikify name=dstyle text=<<divstyle>> >
<div class="colorplay-colorbox" style=<<dstyle>>>
<<rgbcolor>>
</div>
</$wikify>

<!-- buttons to copy the color -->
<small>Click to copy to clipboard</small>

<$wikify name=Hslcolor text=<<hslcolor>> >
<$macrocall $name=copy-color-to-clipboard color=<<Hslcolor>> />
</$wikify>

<$wikify name=HexColor text=<<hexcolor>> >
<$macrocall $name=copy-color-to-clipboard color={{{[<HexColor>addprefix[#]]}}} />
</$wikify>

<$wikify name=RgbColor text=<<rgbcolor>> >
<$macrocall $name=copy-color-to-clipboard color=<<RgbColor>> />
</$wikify>


</$vars>

</div>



<<details sum:"RGB and RGBA Color Values" src:"{{RGB and RGBA Color Values}}" status:closed labelClass:"bg-secondary text-white">>






\define colorOneTid() xx$:/temp/1
\define colorTwoTid() xx$:/temp/2

\define rgb1() rgb($(red1)$, $(green1)$, $(blue1)$)
\define rgb2() rgb($(red2)$, $(green2)$, $(blue2)$)
\define hslcolor() <<rgb2hsl $(red)$ $(green)$ $(blue)$>>
\define hexcolor1() <<rgb2hex $(red1)$ $(green1)$ $(blue1)$>>
\define hexcolor2() <<rgb2hex $(red2)$ $(green2)$ $(blue2)$>>

\define divstyle() 
background-color:$(rgb2)$;
color:$(rgb1)$;
\end


\define copy-color-to-clipboard(color)
<$button class="btn btn-sm" style=<<dstyle>> message="tm-copy-to-clipboard" param="$color$" >
<$text text="$color$" />
</$button>
\end


<!-- display the rgb sliders -->
<$vars tmpTid=<<colorOneTid>> >
''Foreground color'' {{$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/ui/rgb-sliders}}
</$vars>
<$vars tmpTid=<<colorTwoTid>> >
''Background color'' {{$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/ui/rgb-sliders}}
</$vars>

<$vars red1={{{[<colorOneTid>get[red]]}}}
       green1={{{[<colorOneTid>get[green]]}}}
       blue1={{{[<colorOneTid>get[blue]]}}} 
 
       red2={{{[<colorTwoTid>get[red]]}}}
       green2={{{[<colorTwoTid>get[green]]}}}
       blue2={{{[<colorTwoTid>get[blue]]}}} >

<$wikify name=dstyle text=<<divstyle>> >
<div class="colorplay-colorbox" style=<<dstyle>>>
<<rgb1>> on <<rgb2>>
</div>
</$wikify>



<table>
<tr><th style="width:50%">Criteria</th><th style="width:20%">Results</th></tr>
<$wikify name=hex1 text=<<hexcolor1>> >
<$wikify name=hex2 text=<<hexcolor2>> >
<$wikify name=ratio text="""<$macrocall $name=contrast hex1=<<hex1>> hex2=<<hex2>> />""" >
<$list filter="[<ratio>!is[blank]]" emptyMessage="<tr><td colspan=2>wrong colors input</td></tr>">
<tr><td>value</td><td><$text text={{{[[1]divide<ratio>fixed[2]]}}} /></td></tr>
<tr>
<td>AA-level large text (3:1)</td>
<td><$list filter="[<ratio>compare:number:lt[0.33333]]" emptyMessage="FAIL">PASS</$list></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>AA-level small text  (4.5:1)</td>
<td><$list filter="[<ratio>compare:number:lt[0.22222]]" emptyMessage="FAIL">PASS</$list></td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td>AAA-level large text (4.5:1)</td>
<td><$list filter="[<ratio>compare:number:lt[0.22222]]" emptyMessage="FAIL">PASS</$list></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>AAA-level small text (7:1)</td>
<td><$list filter="[<ratio>compare:number:lt[0.14285]]" emptyMessage="FAIL">PASS</$list></td>
</tr>
</$list>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</table>
</$vars>

<<details sum:"WCAG Levels for Readability" src:"{{WCAG Levels for Readability}}">>







<div style="display:flex; max-width:100%; flex-wrap: wrap; flex-direction: row;">

<<colorbox2 rgb(255,0,0)>>

<<colorbox2 rgb(0,0,255)>>

<<colorbox2 rgb(60,179,113)>>

<<colorbox2 rgb(238,130,238)>>

<<colorbox2 rgb(255,165,0)>>

<<colorbox2 rgb(106,90,205)>>

</div>






\define tmpTid() xx$:/temp/color-name-to-rgba

\define select-extended-colors(tmpTid:"xx$:/temp/colorname")
<$select tiddler=<<__tmpTid__>> default='aliceblue' actions=<<myactions>> >
<$list filter="[[$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/data/extended-color-names]indexes[]]">
<option value=<<currentTiddler>>><$view field='title'/></option>
</$list>
\end

\define myactions()
<$wikify name=hexcolor text="""<$macrocall $name=name2hex color={{{[<tmpTid>get[text]]}}} />""">
<$wikify name=rgbcolor text="""<$macrocall $name=hex2rgb H=<<hexcolor>> />""" >
<$vars r={{{[<rgbcolor>split[,]nth[1]removeprefix[rgb(]]}}} 
       g={{{[<rgbcolor>split[,]nth[2]]}}}
       b={{{[<rgbcolor>split[,]nth[3]removesuffix[)]]}}} >

<$action-setfield $tiddler=<<tmpRgbaTid>> $field="red"   $value=<<r>> />
<$action-setfield $tiddler=<<tmpRgbaTid>> $field="green" $value=<<g>> />
<$action-setfield $tiddler=<<tmpRgbaTid>> $field="blue"  $value=<<b>> />
<$action-setfield $tiddler=<<tmpRgbaTid>> $field="alpha" $value=1.0   />

</$vars>
</$wikify>
</$wikify>
\end



Choose a color from the list of html extended color names and edit it using the RGBA color tools.
<br>

<$vars tmpRgbaTid="xx$:/temp/new-rgba">

Select an extended color name: <$macrocall $name=select-extended-colors tmpTid=<<tmpTid>> />

{{RGBA Colors}}
</$vars>






\define rgbacolor() rgba($(red)$, $(green)$, $(blue)$, $(alpha)$)
\define hslacolor() <<rgba2hsla $(red)$ $(green)$ $(blue)$ $(alpha)$>>
\define hexcolor()  <<rgba2hexa $(red)$ $(green)$ $(blue)$ $(alpha)$>>

\define divstyle() 
background-color:$(rgbacolor)$;
color:<<contrastcolour target:"$(rgbacolor)$" colourA:black colourB:white>>;
\end


\define copy-color-to-clipboard(color)
<$button class="btn btn-sm" style=<<dstyle>> message="tm-copy-to-clipboard" param="$color$" >
<$text text="$color$" />
</$button>
\end

\define createNewColor()
<$action-createtiddler $basetitle="New Color" $savetitle=<<saveTid>> tags=color
hexcolor=<<HexColor>> hslacolor=<<Hslacolor>> rgbacolor=<<rgbacolor>>/>
<$action-navigate $to={{{[<saveTid>get[text]]}}} $scroll=yes/>
\end


<!-- display the rgb sliders -->
{{$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/ui/rgba-sliders}}


<$vars red  =  {{{[<tmpRgbaTid>get[red]]}}}
       green = {{{[<tmpRgbaTid>get[green]]}}}
       blue=   {{{[<tmpRgbaTid>get[blue]]}}}
       alpha=  {{{[<tmpRgbaTid>get[alpha]]}}} >


<div class=colorbox-container>
<$wikify name=dstyle text=<<divstyle>> >
<div class="colorplay-colorbox" style=<<dstyle>> >
<<rgbacolor>>
</div>
</$wikify>
</div>

<!-- buttons to copy the color -->
<small>Click to copy to clipboard</small>

<$wikify name=Hslacolor text=<<hslacolor>> >

<$macrocall $name=copy-color-to-clipboard color=<<Hslacolor>> />


<$wikify name=HexColor text=<<hexcolor>> >

<$macrocall $name=copy-color-to-clipboard color={{{[<HexColor>addprefix[#]]}}} />


<$macrocall $name=copy-color-to-clipboard color=<<rgbacolor>> />


<$button class="btn btn-sm" actions=<<createNewColor>> >
''Create Color Tiddler''
</$button>

</$wikify>
</$wikify>
</$vars>


<<details sum:"RGB and RGBA Color Values" src:"{{RGB and RGBA Color Values}}" status:closed labelClass:"bg-secondary text-white">>

"mood-8": "#ddaacc"
}






;What is the definition of a SHADE?
:Color Theory defines a True Shade as any pure Hue or mixture of pure colors with only Black added. In other words, it contains absolutely no White or Gray.

;What is the definition of a TINT
A Tint is sometimes also called a Pastel. But to be  precise, Color Theory defines a True Tint as any Hue or mixture of pure colors with only White added.


{{Color Hue Tint Tone and Shade.png}}


;Ref
:https://color-wheel-artist.com/hue/
:https://www.beachpainting.com/blog/color-hue-tint-tone-and-shade/

    "mood-4": "#F35F1C"
}

    "mood-3": "#DFEEEE",
    "mood-4": "#FFE08C"

 https://codepen.io/meetajhu/pen/gpEXja
 
 
 <div class="toggle body">
  <svg version="1.1" id="Layer_1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" x="0px" y="0px"
     viewBox="0 0 56.7 57" enable-background="new 0 0 56.7 57" xml:space="preserve">
  <path class="retract" fill="none" stroke="#f1f1f1" stroke-width="4" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-miterlimit="10" d="
    M36,6.3c5.7,2.1,10.2,6.2,12.9,11.1"/>
  <path fill="none" stroke="#f1f1f1" stroke-width="4" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-miterlimit="10" d="
    M48.9,17.4c3.1,5.8,3.9,12.9,1.4,19.7c-4.6,12.4-18.4,18.8-30.8,14.3S0.7,33,5.2,20.5S23.6,1.7,36,6.3"/>
  <polyline class="tick" fill="none" stroke="#f1f1f1" stroke-width="4" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-miterlimit="10" points="
    20.3,25.4 28.6,33.9 46.7,8.3 "/>
  </svg>
</div>
  
<style>
.body {
  background: gainsboro;
}

svg {
  display: block;
  margin: 0 auto;
}

.toggle {
  cursor: pointer;
  background: #ee5626;
  padding: 1em;
  border-radius: 100%;
  display: table;
  width: 200px;
  transition: background 0.3s cubic-bezier(0.455, 0.03, 0.515, 0.955);
  /* Temp Scene Stuff */
  position: absolute;
  transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
  top: 50%;
  left: 50%;
}

.toggle.open {
  background: #4ae4bf;
}

.tick {
  stroke-dasharray: 44;
  stroke-dashoffset: 44;
}

.open .retract {
  stroke-dasharray: 20;
  stroke-dashoffset: 20;
  -webkit-animation: retract 1.5s cubic-bezier(0.19, 1, 0.22, 1) forwards 1;
          animation: retract 1.5s cubic-bezier(0.19, 1, 0.22, 1) forwards 1;
}

.open .tick {
  -webkit-animation: dash 1.5s cubic-bezier(0.19, 1, 0.22, 1) forwards 1;
          animation: dash 1.5s cubic-bezier(0.19, 1, 0.22, 1) forwards 1;
}

@-webkit-keyframes dash {
  from {
    stroke-dashoffset: 44;
  }
  to {
    stroke-dashoffset: 0;
  }
}

@keyframes dash {
  from {
    stroke-dashoffset: 44;
  }
  to {
    stroke-dashoffset: 0;
  }
}
@-webkit-keyframes retract {
  from {
    stroke-dashoffset: 0;
  }
  to {
    stroke-dashoffset: 20;
  }
}
@keyframes retract {
  from {
    stroke-dashoffset: 0;
  }
  to {
    stroke-dashoffset: 20;
  }
}
</style>

|Row one| Cell two in row one|
|Row two| Cell two in row two|
|This is a table|c







\define createTask()
<$action-sendmessage 
  $message="tm-new-tiddler" 
  title="New Task" 
  tags="task" 
  text=<<now "Today is DDth, MMM YYYY">>
  due-date=""
  priority="normal"
  status="not started"
  />
\end

\define newTask()
<$button actions=<<createTask>> class="btn btn-sm btn-info" >New Task
</$button>
\end

<div class="float-right">
<<newTask>>
</div>

<$macrocall $name=table-dynamic filter="[tag[task]]" fields="tbl-checkbox tbl-expand title priority status due-date tags" class="w-100" stateTiddler="your-state-tid"/>






\define color() color:<<hsl2hex 200 100 50>>
<$wikify name=sty text=<<color>> >
<div style=<<sty>> >
Hello - <<color>>
</div>
</$wikify>

<div style="color:hsl(200 100% 50%)">
TEST
</div>


- <<hsl2hex 240 100 50>>

;Ref
: [[$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/macros/hsl2rgb.js]]
: [[$:/plugins/kookma/colorplay/macros/hsl2hex.js]]






Uses the color test from: [[readability/colorTest]]

<$macrocall $name=colorTest test="FG" color1="#eaeaea" color2=<<color primary>>/>

<$macrocall $name=colorTest test="FG" color1="hsl(245,100%, 50%)" color2="#ffe"/>

<$macrocall $name=colorTest test="FG" color1="rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.9)" color2="rgba(255,0,0,0.4)"/>

src="""<<coloraction color:"#fafaf9ff" mod:"#adada0ff" action:getContrast>>

;How much contrast do I need?
The WCAG has multiple levels, and the relevant ones for us are called ''AA'' and ''AAA''.

''AA'' is an acceptable level of accessibility, and ''AAA'' is one step above: the most complete accessibility ruleset there is.

;AA Level
: ''4.5'': For normal text.
: ''3'': For large (24px or more) or bold (19px*) text.
For non-text elements, like icons, charts and controls, a minimum contrast of 3 is needed.

;AAA Level
: ''7'': For normal text.
: ''4.5'': For large (24px or more) or bold (19px^^1^^) text.

^^1^^ this is actually 18.66 pixels, but rounded up.








Today is 19th, March 2021

https://davidmathlogic.com/colorblind/#%23D81B60-%231E88E5-%23FFC107-%23004D40

!! We see colors differently
About 1 in 20 people are colorblind in some way. This means that one or more of the types of cone cells in their eyes — the cells we use to detect color — does not work normally. Because of this, a person who is colorblind sees a reduced color space; two colors which appear distinct to a person with normal color vision may appear to be the same to a person who is colorblind. This phenomenon is not random. Mathematically, there are lines through color space — called "confusion lines" — such that every color on a confusion line appears the same to a person who is colorblind as every other color on that same confusion line.

;Remarks
: Use this for readability






\define circle2(r:20, color, selected:"yes")
<svg width=30 height=30 style="vertical-align: middle;">
<circle cx=15 cy=15 r=12 stroke="black" stroke-width=0 fill="$color$"/>
<$list filter="[<__selected__>match[yes]]" variable=null>
<circle cx=15 cy=15 r=8 stroke="white" stroke-width=2 fill=none/>
</$list>
</svg>
\end

\define circle3(color, selected:"no")
<svg width="20" height="20" style="vertical-align: middle;">
<circle cx="10" cy="10" r="9" stroke="grey"  fill=<<__color__>>/>
<$list filter="[<__selected__>match[yes]]" variable=null>
<circle cx=10 cy=10 r=7 stroke="white" stroke-width=1.5 fill=none/>
</$list>
</svg>
\end

<<circle2 18 blue no>>
<<circle2 18 "rgba(0,0,255,0.2)" yes>>

<<circle3 "rgba(0,0,255,0.7)" yes>><<circle3 "rgba(0,0,255,0.7)" no>>
